MHP works with communities, developers and borrowers to create innovative policy and financing solutions that provide affordable homes and better lives for the people of Massachusetts. At MHP, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Create and Manage contracts and invoices for consultants
Review applications for completeness
Administrative support for tracking consultant contracts, invoices, reconciliation of accounts with Finance, and draft annual reporting

General support for presentations, as needed, for senior staff
Draft reports of all Community Assistance programs including monthly Public Affairs report and quarterly Board report.
Point person for Housing Toolbox website for updates and loading new content
Team point person for Communications
General support for Community Assistance Team and MHP

About United Way

We unite people to create change that lasts: We call it harnessing the power of people working together. And that means everyone – individuals, nonprofits, companies, and government agencies. We work every day to achieve our vision and mission by focusing on the three core building blocks of a strong, vibrant community: ensuring that all families have the resources and opportunities to lift themselves out of poverty; preparing children to enter school ready to learn and succeed; Inspiring and supporting youth to stay in school and realize positive options for the future.

About Boston Builds Credit

Boston Builds Credit is a first of its kind citywide credit building initiative that seeks to empower Bostonians to build prime credit scores in order to increase their financial stability, build assets, and create wealth. When done citywide, we believe that credit building can be a powerful tool for addressing income inequality and the racial wealth gap. We envision a Boston where no one is held back from pursuing their goals because of Credit.

BBC was created by the United Way, City of Boston, and LISC Boston. Working with our network of community partners, we provide Bostonians with increased access to the tools they need to build a prime credit score, including free credit-building workshops, free financial coaching, and safe credit building products. We also work with funders, financial institutions, credit bureaus, and other leaders in the industry to advocate for consumer-focused systems change. Most of all, we're on a mission to make credit work for everyone. Join us as we work to empower 25,000 Bostonians to achieve a prime credit score by 2025!

STATUS: 37.5 hours per week for one-year appointment

Position Overview

The Communications & Marketing Specialist (“Specialist”) is an integral member of the Boston Builds Credit (BBC) team. The Specialist will oversee the development of initiative-wide communication and marketing strategy designed to raise public awareness of and engagement with credit building at the community level. The Specialist will develop and execute coordinated strategies for the BBC website, newsletter, social media, and public information campaign. With a growing national focus on the initiative, this is an incredible opportunity for a communications and marketing professional interested in putting their skills to work for a cause.

Responsibilities

Development of an initiative wide communications and marketing strategy
The Specialist will oversee the development of initiative-wide communication and marketing strategy. This strategy will knit together different channels of engagement, including the BBC website, newsletter, social media strategy, and public information campaign.

Management of the BBC Website
The Specialist will oversee the enhancement of the website, turning it into a trusted credit building resource for Bostonians, and will be responsible for regular maintenance of the site, including content and resource updates. The Specialist may work with contracted consultants on content development where outside expertise in credit building is needed. The Specialist will ensure the website strategy is aligned with other aspects of the BBC communications and marketing strategy, including the public information campaign and social media strategies. As part of this work, the specialist will set site traffic and engagement goals.

Management of BBC Social Media accounts.
The Specialist will develop and launch social media strategy for BBC in order to engage Bostonians and share information and resources for how to improve their credit and engage in systems change. This will include the development of strategy as well as ongoing content and account management. The Specialist may work with contracted consultants on content development where outside expertise in credit building is needed. Social media will be mostly consumer-facing (ie. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram) with some attention to partner resources and thought leadership (via LinkedIn).

Management of BBC Newsletter
The Specialist will design a newsletter strategy to engage partners in BBC and encourage credit building and advocacy among their constituencies. Newsletter should provide useful content to partners with 1) updates on what is happening at the partner and backbone level, and 2) policy and systems-level information and research on best practices in credit building. The Specialist will write and distribute newsletters regularly (at least bimonthly) and set goals for increasing subscribers and engagement.

Launch of a public information campaign
The Specialist will oversee the final development and launch of a public information campaign, working closely with BBC’s Director, United Way’s marketing team, and with significant input from the Community Advisory Council and PR Committee. This will include overseeing the development of consumer-facing materials, website collateral, and other materials depending on what other distribution channels are selected.

PR Committee Management and partner and resident engagement
The Specialist will staff BBC’s PR Committee, a working group made up of BBC partners and Boston residents, in order to ensure that partners and Boston residents are engaged in the development of the above-mentioned communication and marketing strategies. Staffing this committee will include working with co-chairs to set annual goals for the committee, plan agendas for monthly meetings, develop meeting materials, and ensure meeting notes are taken and distributed. The Specialist will also look for other opportunities to collaborate with Boston residents through the Community Advisory Council.

Support for credit building workshop promotion and tracking
As part of ongoing maintenance of the BBC website, the Specialist will correspond with partners to keep the workshop calendar on the BBC website up to date. In addition, the Specialist will collect quarterly attendance data from partners. Potential areas of focus might also include: 1) developing BBC workshop quality standards; 2) designing an automated system for registering in and/or collecting and maintaining data regarding workshops.

Alpha Paw Company Overview: Crazy fast-growing pet eCommerce

Alpha Paw runs some of the top websites for pet owners on the planet, and we’d love your help building them out! We’re also a force for good in the world, donating over 250,000 meals last year for pet shelters, and donating money and supplies to 30+ shelters. 




With 25 Facebook pages, 20 Facebook groups and more reaching 5,000,000 pet owners. We run several eCommerce stores and content sites related to dogs and cats. We’re also a huge seller on Amazon and growing fast. 




Job Summary

Alpha Paw has grown to $20m/yr in just 2 years. We’re on track this year to hit $40m/yr, and our goal is to hit $100m/yr in the next 2 years. We’re ambitious AF and would love to have you along for the ride!




Alpha Paw is looking for a creative and detail-oriented full-time copywriter to work on our website and packaging copy. This role will work closely with our design, web, and Product Development team. They will also work closely with the marketing team to ensure messaging aligns across all platforms. This role will help us evolve and communicate our brand as we continue to grow.




At Alpha Paw, we look for you to hit the ground running from day one. 




﻿What You’ll Do

Provide engaging website copy (including general brand copy, callouts, and PDP verbiage)
Proofread packaging and collaborate with the design team for optimal product copy
Provide copy and care & use for products per Account Manager presentations and e-commerce accounts
Dictate creative direction per brand guidelines
Act as liaison between the company and legal partner on all brand registration/trademark matters
Work with team to ensure all domains have been acquired for company brands
Create and implement detailed brand guidelines for prominent in-house brands
Update catalog copy and company deck
Write editorial articles and pitches to be featured in digital and traditional print publications
Work with external content partners on e-commerce sites.




Who You Are

Bachelor’s degree in relevant field - English, writing, journalism, communications, etc.
2-3 years of writing experience for consumer products
Must be detail-oriented and have a passion for accuracy
Strong writing, grammatical, and communication skills
Must have a deep understanding of our brand and voice
Ability to work efficiently and problem solve in a fast-paced environment with multiple urgent deadlines
Must be a team player
Working knowledge of Photoshop and Illustrator is a plus
